title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Syrma SGS, Shinhyup Electronics form ₹1,800-cr JV for electronics manufacturing in India
Make in India boosts sniper rifle production
items.summary:
*India's defence industry marks a milestone with MEIL and ICOMM Tele Ltd securing a contract to supply 200 CSR 338 sniper rifles for CRPF.*
- The rifles will be manufactured at the new ICOMM CARACAL Small Arms Complex in Hyderabad, a state-of-the-art facility in partnership with UAE's CARACAL.
- This initiative supports *Make in India*, enhancing local manufacturing, technology, and job creation in Hyderabad's defence sector.

items.title: Tata Advanced Systems opens first overseas defence factory in Morocco
items.summary:
*Tata Advanced Systems (TASL)* inaugurated Morocco’s largest defence manufacturing facility in Casablanca, for producing the *WhAP 8x8* armored platform.  
*This marks India’s first private company overseas defence plant*, strengthening its strategic military partnerships.  
The facility, spread over 20,000 sqm, is set to supply Morocco and expand across Africa, showcasing India’s growing defense technology capabilities.

items.title: Schneider Electric partners with ISRO for satellite launches
items.summary:
- *Schneider Electric* has partnered with *ISRO* to provide *automation technology* at the *Satish Dhawan Space Centre* in Sriharikota. 
- The collaboration aims to enhance *seamless operations* for *launch vehicle* and *satellite missions*, supporting India’s space ambitions. 
- With over 15 years supporting ISRO's landmark projects like *Chandrayaan-3* and *Mars Orbiter Mission*, Schneider Electric plays a key role in India’s space ecosystem.

items.title: Agnikul Cosmos Launches Additive Manufacturing Unit
items.summary:
*Agnikul Cosmos has commissioned India's first large-scale additive manufacturing facility for aerospace and rocket components.*
- The unit enables **3D printing of parts up to one metre high**, reducing costs by up to 50% and enhancing supply chain resilience.
- This development supports faster production of **powerful rocket engines** and marks a significant advancement in **spacetech manufacturing** in India.

items.title: Workflow automation linked to productivity gains
items.summary:
- *Automation of frontline workflows* can boost productivity by around *20%* across industries like retail, manufacturing, and transportation.
- The study by Zebra Technologies and Oxford Economics found that automation improves *customer satisfaction*, *employee productivity*, and *operational visibility*, while AI enhances *risk detection* and *inventory management*.
- Significant financial benefits could be achieved, with top companies potentially earning an *average of $3 billion in additional revenue* by optimizing workflows.

items.title: SmartSoC, DB HiTek partner to expand semiconductor foundry services in India
items.summary:
- *SmartSoC* has formed a strategic partnership with Korea’s *DB HiTek* to enhance access to *speciality foundry services* in India.
- SmartSoC will act as DB HiTek’s *design partner* in India, promoting services and facilitating technical engagement for *analogue* and *mixed-signal fabrication*.
- This collaboration aligns with India’s growing *government support* and rising demand for *foundry services*, boosting the country’s *semiconductor industry* growth.

items.title: Cochin Shipyard partners with HD KSOE for vessel construction
items.summary:
- *Cochin Shipyard Limited (CSL)* signed an MoU with *HD Korea Shipbuilding & Offshore Engineering* to collaborate on *large vessel construction*, aligning with India’s *shipbuilding ambitions*.
- CSL will utilize its 310-meter dry dock to build vessels like *Suezmax tankers*, *container ships*, and *bulk carriers*, with capacity for up to six vessels per year.
- The partnership includes a proposed ₹3,700 crore *Block Fabrication Facility* in Kochi and potential greenfield projects in Tamil Nadu, aiming to boost *India's maritime industry* and create thousands of jobs.

items.title: Smart, connected, and future-ready manufacturing
items.summary:
- *Indian manufacturing* is at a pivotal point, with many relying on outdated processes despite growth projections.
- Eazy Business Solutions offers an integrated, *AI-driven* ecosystem (ERP + DMS + SFA) that automates and optimizes the *entire value chain*, from production to sales.
- *Digital transformation* enhances agility, reduces costs, and builds resilience, positioning Indian firms to be *future-ready* in a competitive global market.

items.title: Surveillance system chips big opportunity for India: Renesas’ Malini
From bricks to boom: GST 2.0 paves the way for affordable growth
items.summary:
- *GST 2.0* simplifies India's tax structure, reducing rates to just 5% and 18%, which will benefit the construction sector.
- Lowering GST on key materials like *cement*, *steel*, and *bricks* could reduce construction costs and boost affordable housing.
- These reforms aim to accelerate *urban growth*, *infrastructure development*, and make *homes* more accessible for families and businesses alike.

items.title: From heavy missions to light footprints: Aluminium’s green shift
items.summary:
*Aluminium is vital for industries like transport and renewable energy, but its production is energy-intensive and carbon-heavy.* 
- *Green aluminium, produced with renewable energy and innovative technologies, offers a sustainable solution.* 
- *India aims for net-zero emissions by 2070, focusing on renewable energy, recycling, and clean technology to reduce aluminium's carbon footprint.*

items.title: US White House Blocks Steel Plant Closure
items.summary:
*The White House intervened to block US Steel's plan to idle the Granite City plant in Illinois.*
- *This intervention was under a national security agreement allowing the federal government to influence decisions on domestic steel production.*
- *US Steel reversed its decision, citing a solution found to continue steel slab supply, with the White House confirming its involvement.*

items.title: ACME Solar secures ₹1,100 crore refinancing for 300 MW project
items.summary:
- *ACME Solar*, a Gurugram-based renewable energy producer, secured **₹1,100 crore** domestic funding to refinance a **300 MW** project in Rajasthan.
- The refinancing, from *State Bank of India* for **17 years**, aims to reduce *financing costs* by about *100 basis points* and strengthen *financial stability*.
- The company's large portfolio of **6.97 GW**, including solar, wind, and hybrid projects, highlights its focus on *growth* and *credit rating improvements*.

items.title: Iron ore drops amid weak Chinese steel demand
items.summary:
*Iron ore futures declined due to weaker steel demand in China, despite holiday restocking.
*China's steel production is curbing new capacity to address oversupply and falling prices.
*Meanwhile, Australian iron ore prices reached an 18-month high driven by Chinese demand.*

items.title: Inox Solar begins manufacturing at Gujarat plant
items.summary:
*Inox Solar's arm, Inox Clean Energy, started production at a new *solar module manufacturing plant* in Bavla, Gujarat.*
- The *fully-automated plant* produces *N-type TOPCon modules* with advanced technology, including bifacial modules for increased efficiency.
- The Bavla facility will expand to a *3 GW capacity*, and Inox is also establishing a *4.8 GW solar cell-plus-module plant* in Odisha, enhancing India's solar manufacturing ecosystem.*

items.title: Silicon saga: From CPU to XPU, challengers chip in
items.summary: *Nvidia* currently dominates the AI chip market with around 80% share, but new competitors like Google, Tesla, Amazon, and others are developing **custom silicon** to reduce dependency and enhance performance. *Diversification* of AI workloads requires **specialized XPUs**, which can be more cost-effective, energy-efficient, and tailored to specific needs, challenging Nvidia’s ecosystem. The *market* is projected to reach up to $1 trillion in AI chips by 2030, reflecting rapid growth and innovation, with smaller players gaining ground in efficiency and adoption.

items.title: Nvidia invests $100B in OpenAI partnership
items.summary:
*Nvidia will invest up to $100 billion in OpenAI* and supply data center chips, creating a strategic alliance in AI development. 
- The deal involves *financial stakes* for Nvidia and access to advanced chips for OpenAI, aiming to strengthen their positions in the competitive AI landscape. 
- Industry analysts see the partnership as *positive* for Nvidia but raise concerns about potential market monopolies and competitive impacts.

items.title: India probes Chinese copper data cable imports
summary: *India's Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) has initiated an anti-dumping investigation into copper data cables imported from China.*
*The move follows a petition from domestic firms like Sterlite Technologies and Birla Cable, citing material injury due to imports.*
*All structured copper data cables, including CAT 5e to CAT 7A, are covered, with the investigation period from April 2024 to March 2025.*

items.title: Cambay basin loss not to have big impact on Vedanta: Analysts
items.summary:
- *Vedanta's* request to extend its *Cambay basin* contract is unlikely to significantly impact its *financials*, as the field's contribution is relatively small.
- The *Cambay* field accounted for about *5% of Vedanta's production* in 2025, with minimal influence on the company's overall revenue.
- Analysts suggest that Vedanta's upcoming *demerger* and focus on other business segments will limit any short-term effects from this development, with the *oil and gas* division valued at around *10%* of the total company worth.

items.title: Synopsys expands Bengaluru presence with new R&D hub
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Synopsys* opens a new Bengaluru R&D hub, expanding its 30-year India presence to bolster **EDA**, **IP**, and verification.
- The 455,000 sq ft facility at Bagmane Capital will support silicon-to-systems design and follows the **Ansys** acquisition, boosting total addressable market to **$31B**.
- *India* is a key innovation hub, with roughly one-third of Synopsys' global engineering workforce, and the expansion aims to shorten time-to-market across **semiconductors**, **automotive**, **aerospace**, and healthcare.

items.title: Amit Shah urges shift to organic farming
items.summary:
- Amit Shah urged farmers to reduce the use of *pesticides* and *fertilizers* and shift to **organic farming**, promising greater profits for cultivators.
- He highlighted GST cuts on farming gear and the launch of **Bharat Organics** and cooperative networks to support organic producers.
- Shah said India can gain a larger share of the global organic market through cooperative initiatives and environment-friendly farming.

items.title: Ethylene surge to pressure US, EU chemical firms
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- China's rapid *ethylene* capacity expansion could depress *global prices* and challenge producers.
- US and European producers face margin pressure from *oversupply*, higher costs, and aging plants.
- Analysts warn capacity growth may outpace demand, risking exports from China and continued price volatility.

items.title: India plans 'bodyguard' satellites after near-miss orbit
items.summary:
- *Bodyguard* satellites to protect orbiting assets and counter threats. 
- A mid-2024 near-miss saw a neighboring country's satellite come within 1 km of an ISRO craft. 
- The plan includes LiDAR satellites, ground-based radars, and a ₹270 billion push for about 50 surveillance satellites.

items.title: Notebook makers push GST rethink on inverted duty
items.summary:
- The Exercise Book Manufacturers Association says the government should revisit GST rates, arguing the *inverted duty structure* after rationalisation raises production costs and limits pass‑through to students.
- They warn that a **nil GST rate** for notebooks blocks input tax credits, making inputs and capital goods ineligible for refunds and pushing costs higher.
- They propose applying a **5% GST** on all paper products or providing a refund mechanism for input taxes, citing a notebook market size of around ₹10,000 crore and concerns about cheaper imported pulp.

items.title: Kuwait's oil capacity reaches 3.2m bpd
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- *Kuwait's crude oil production capacity stands at 3.2 million barrels per day*, the highest in more than a decade, according to Oil Minister *Tariq Al-Roumi*. 
- Under the *OPEC+* agreement, Kuwait plans to raise output to *2.559 million bpd* from October, with eight members lifting by *137,000 bpd* in October. 
- The *IEA* and *OPEC* outlooks project continued demand growth in 2025–26, supporting a rebound in global *oil demand*.

items.title: Pinnacle to supply Amrit Bharat Express seating
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- Pinnacle Industries will design and manufacture sleeper berths and executive seating for Indian Railways' *Amrit Bharat Express*, covering both air-conditioned and non-air-conditioned coaches. 
- The seating features include thicker cushions, aluminium upper-berth extrusions, color blending, anti-injury fittings, and *EN45545-2 HL3* fire-safety compliance. 
- Arihant Mehta of Pinnacle says the *Made in India* seating aligns with Indian Railways' modernization goals to provide safer, affordable, and accessible long-distance travel.

items.title: Nuclear projects slow after record 2024 output
items.summary: - Global nuclear power production hit a record in 2024 at *2,677 TWh*, but keeping that level will require more *startups*, investment and new plants amid aging fleets and disruptions.\n- To hold output through 2030, about *44 additional startups* beyond the scheduled ones are needed, roughly 2.5x the pace of the past decade.\n- Risks from aging fleets, slow construction, renewables competition and China-led development threaten growth; SMRs show limited progress outside China.

items.title: Apple's foldable iPhone may resemble two iPhone Airs
items.author: TOI Tech Desk
items.summary:
- The foldable iPhone is reportedly a titanium-bodied design that resembles two iPhone Air devices joined side-by-side, with an ultra-thin per-side profile. 
- Bloomberg's Mark Gurman calls it a **design achievement** with a starting price around *$2,000–$2,300*. 
- Apple is ramping up production for 2026 with a pilot line in Taiwan and a fall launch, aiming for a halo effect across the iPhone lineup.

items.title: India's logistics sector to triple to ₹120 trillion by 2035: Report
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- The Indian logistics sector is projected to triple to about **₹120 trillion** by 2035, driven by heavy public spending and reforms.
- Growth will come from infrastructure investments and policy measures like the *National Infrastructure Pipeline*, *PM Gati Shakti*, the *National Logistics Policy*, and greater digitalisation.
- By 2030-35, *GST 2.0* and the *National Logistics Policy* aim to formalise up to **60%** of the industry, improving efficiency and lowering costs.

items.title: GST reforms could lift India's GDP by 0.8%: Puri
items.author: Hardeep Singh Puri
items.summary:
- *Hardeep Singh Puri* says GST reforms could boost GDP by 0.8% and benefit all sections, especially the lower middle class.
- The reforms aim to ease compliance, lower prices, and spur growth across sectors from manufacturing to MSMEs.
- PM Modi frames Next Generation GST reforms as a GST Savings Festival to boost savings and propel inclusive growth.

items.title: Carbon Masters funds to scale biomethane & fertiliser
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- CMIPL raised undisclosed equity funding to scale its *biomethane* and *organic fertiliser* business, led by **Schneider Electric Energy Access Asia (SEEAA)**, **Sangam Ventures** and **IAN Group**.
- SEEAA’s Vikram Raman and Synchron Group’s Sankaran will join Carbon Masters’ board, highlighting a focus on the *low-carbon future* and climate-tech decarbonisation.
- The funding will scale *biomethane* production, expand the fertiliser portfolio, boost plant efficiency, and support five new *SPVs* with Ostara Advisors as bankers.

items.title: Europe at Taiwan's largest defence show
items.summary:
- *Europe* steps up its profile at Taiwan's defence show amid China tensions, shifting focus from a US-led arms market.
- *Airbus* and the German Trade Office Taipei showcased drones and security solutions, signaling deeper European defence ties with Taipei.
- The move, along with high-level visits, hints at lasting regional implications as Europe pursues broader engagement despite Beijing's opposition.

items.title: India pushes states to buy more clean energy
items.summary:
- The federal renewable energy ministry is in talks with state governments to buy more *clean energy* as state utilities delay purchases.
- Minister *Pralhad Joshi* said a second round of talks will be held to persuade states to secure prices that favor buyers.
- Government data show over **44 gigawatts** of unsold clean energy, underscoring weaker demand from state utilities.

items.title: Rossell Techsys wins Boeing T-7A contract
items.summary:
- Rossell Techsys signs a long-term *IDIQ* contract with **Boeing** to manufacture electrical panel assemblies for the **T-7A Red Hawk** pilot training system, enabling up to 1,200 shipsets through 2033.
- It previously held an IDIQ for wire harnesses on the same platform and has been involved in engineering and manufacturing development and early flight tests.
- MD **Rishab Gupta** says the deal strengthens the Boeing partnership and reinforces India as a hub for *aerospace manufacturing excellence*.

items.title: FMCG companies brace for retailer and distributor comeback
items.author: Sagar Malviya, ET Bureau
items.summary: - **Distributor** and **retailer** orders are expected to rebound as the new **GST** cuts and revised **MRP** take effect, reversing a two-week slowdown in pricing clarity.\n- Inventories will be replenished, but **consumer demand** may not spike immediately since price cuts are not time-bound and discounts reflect revised **GST** rates.\n- Firms say they are in a 'firefighting' mode, reaching thousands of distributors and kirana outlets, with tactics like temporary pack-size increases amid an **11%** average price cut.

items.title: Punjab panel onboards NXP, Dixon, CDIL for electronics
items.author: Mukul Yudhveer Singh
items.summary:
- The Punjab government has formed a 14-member panel chaired by Dr Kamaljeet Singh to draft a tailored electronics and semiconductors policy roadmap, with on-board leaders including **NXP Semiconductors**, **Dixon Appliances** and **Continental Device India Ltd (CDIL)**. 
- The panel spans across the value chain with MSMEs like Anand Suryanarayanan of Tripase Technologies and Sanjiv Singh Sethi of Gillard Electronics, and includes Suresh Sharma of Allengers, Riot Labz and DRDO, aiming for **design-led manufacturing**, stronger **MSME participation**, greater **R&D collaboration** and **investment attraction**. 
- With a due by **October** deadline, the roadmap seeks to position Punjab in India’s semiconductor growth and can be amended as the sector evolves, potentially influencing future policy.

items.title: Halol Plant Drives MG Motor’s EV Growth
items.author: Kriti Saraiya, ETManufacturing
items.summary:
- The Halol plant blends human skills with Industry 4.0, placing people at the center of EV manufacturing as MG Motor builds Comet, Windsor, Windsor Pro, ZS EV and M9 on a multi-model line.
- Battery assembly remains core, with in-house packs for Comet/Windsor, outsourced for ZS EV, producing 100–145 packs daily; 81% of this team are women and 41% of the overall workforce.
- With 80% of output EV-focused, Halol can expand capacity as MG prepares the M9 luxury EV on GA3, while GA1 remains multi-model.

items.title: Inox Solar starts production at Gujarat plant
items.summary:
- Inox Clean Energy starts production at the Bavla, Gujarat module plant with 1.2 GW initial capacity of a 3 GW facility.
- The plant manufactures **N-type TOPCon** modules (M10, G12R, G12 cells) to boost CUF and efficiency.
- An integrated **4.8 GW** Odisha cell-plus-module facility is planned to strengthen India’s domestic solar supply chains.

items.title: LG Innotek doubles camera module production in Vietnam
items.summary:
- LG Innotek has completed the *V3 plant in Hai Phong, Vietnam* and begun operations, boosting camera module capacity.
- The company will deploy a *Gumi–Paju–Vietnam tri-hub* strategy to cut costs and position *Vietnam* as a mass production hub.
- *AI‑driven quality inspection* slashed defect analysis times by up to *90%* and cut process optimization time from *72 hours to under 6 hours*.

items.title: Iron ore firms: rising building demand lifts steel output
items.summary:
- Iron ore futures climbed as **steel production** rose on stronger demand for *building materials* ahead of holidays.
- Prices on the **Dalian Commodity Exchange** and the Singapore Exchange edged higher as operations resumed and restocking continued.
- Chinese blast-furnace output reached about 90.4% capacity, with *port stockpiles* down and broader *inventory reductions* evident.

items.title: Drug firms flag timeline for regulator's rule
items.author: Teena Thacker
items.summary:
- *MSME pharmaceutical associations* warn that the revised *GMP* requirements and the Jan 1, 2026 deadline are too abrupt and could force 4,000–5,000 units to shut down, risking shortages of affordable medicines.
- **Extension** sought for MSMEs with turnover under ₹50 crore, proposing up to April 2027 to invest and comply with the new standards.
- The letter also accuses *CDSCO* of selective risk-based inspections and says the push is influenced by large corporates and MNCs, urging government hand-holding and guidance.

items.title: Pfizer eyes $7.3B Metsera takeover
items.summary:
- Pfizer nears a cash takeover of Metsera for about *$7.3B*, at *$47.50 per share* with up to *$22.50 per share* in milestones.
- Metsera’s stock value around *$3.5B* after a blockbuster Nasdaq debut, underscoring demand for its GLP-1 obesity therapies.
- The *global weight-loss drug market* could be worth about **$150 billion** by the early 2030s, fueling investor interest.

items.title: Centre sets foodgrain output target at 362.5 MT in 2025-26
items.author: TNN
items.summary:
- *Monsoon rainfall and higher acreage push the Centre to set a **362.5 MT** foodgrain target for 2025-26, up from ~354 MT in 2024-25.*
- *The target includes a **171 MT** rabi output and a **119 MT** wheat target for 2025-26.*
- *Union agriculture minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced the plan at the national rabi conference, with a focus on **pulses, oilseeds** and timely fertiliser supply.*

items.title: PLI scheme: ₹1.76 lakh cr investments, 12 lakh jobs
items.author: IANS
items.summary: - The PLI scheme has attracted *₹1.76 lakh crore* in committed investments since 2020 and created *over 12 lakh* jobs.\n- It spans *806 applications across 14 sectors*, advancing the *Atmanirbhar Bharat* initiative to boost domestic manufacturing.\n- By March 2025, PLI participants reported combined sales exceeding *₹16.5 lakh crore*, underscoring stronger supply chains and the need for improved logistics.

items.title: SDHI signs ₹4,250 crore MoU with Gujarat Maritime Board
items.summary: - *SDHI* signed a *₹4,250 crore* MoU with the *Gujarat Maritime Board* to advance three projects at the *Pipavav Port shipyard*, home to India’s largest dry dock.\n- Of the total investment, *₹3,500 crore* will expand shipyard capacity, while a *₹200 crore Centre of Excellence for Maritime* will train over 1,000 youth annually and a *200-acre Maritime Cluster* is planned.\n- A separate MoU with *Sagarmala Finance Corporation* will explore shipbuilding projects, maintenance, and financing mechanisms to strengthen *supply chains* and export potential under India’s *Maritime Amrit Kaal Vision 2047*.

items.title: Construction sector faces shortage of 2M skilled workers
items.author: Niranjan Hiranandani
items.summary:
- The construction sector faces a nearly *two million skilled worker shortage*, according to Niranjan Hiranandani, risking growth in housing and real estate. 
- He highlights in-demand trades—carpenters, painters, plumbers, wire men, and electricians—and urges rapid adoption of technology and faster construction methods to close the gap. 
- He calls for policy actions like a clear rental housing policy and accelerated slum redevelopment, arguing housing drives jobs, wealth, and broader economic activity.

items.title: DSCI-Siemens OT lab in Noida
items.summary:
- *DSCI*, a not-for-profit data protection body, partnered with **Siemens** to open an OT Cybersecurity Lab at the NASSCOM campus in Noida to bolster *critical infrastructure* security.
- The lab will serve as an innovation platform for startups, providing access to technology, equipment, and expertise to develop and test cybersecurity solutions in real-world OT scenarios, and will support training in OT cybersecurity practices.
- It will enable research on OT security vulnerabilities, threat detection, and risk management, and disseminate insights to stakeholders for timely mitigation, contributing to India's cybersecurity posture.

items.title: Seawater-to-hydrogen catalyst could cut green fuel costs
items.author: Saurav Anand
items.summary:
- The study reveals a ruthenium-based nanocatalyst with a crystalline–amorphous junction that boosts *seawater electrolysis* and resists chloride corrosion.
- It achieves just 15 mV overpotential at 10 mA cm⁻² and 250 hours' stability in alkaline seawater, enabling direct hydrogen production from seawater.
- Compared with Pt/C and Ru/C, it shows up to **37× higher activity**, potentially lowering freshwater use and green fuel costs.

items.title: Rooftop solar surges as manufacturing shifts to cells
items.author: Saurav Anand, ETEnergyWorld
items.summary:
- Rooftop and open‑access solar now account for over 20% of installs, with government schemes like PM Surya driving faster adoption.
- The domestic push focuses **ALMM** to cover *cells and wafers* by 2028, aiming for multi‑GW capacity via new rules and multiple wafer makers.
- Growth hinges on policy support, cheaper modules, and higher‑efficiency tech such as *TOPCON* and *HJT*, shaping competition and exports.
